poem:
### Shuffling the Deck

In dim corridors where echoes dwell,  
power resides in relentless shuffle,  
faceless masks in shadow-boxed rooms,  
promise fades in the sleeves of suits.  
Yet outside, the sheep graze on sparse hills,  
oblivious to hands that stir the mist,  
quiet as wind threading through ancient stone,  
unmoved by reshaped destinies of men.
